titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Morris and Adele Bergreen Albert Einstein Collection, 1919-1988
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Ronald Patkus and Rachel Schles

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth ClarkeDecember 2006

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Morris and Adele Bergreen Albert Einstein Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Composed mainly of correspondence between Einstein and the executor of his estate, Otto Nathan. Also includes letters from Elsa Einstein to Nathan, as well as some manuscripts, ephemera and photographs of Einstein.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Albert Einstein was a professor of physics at the University of Zurich and the University of Berlin. From 1933 to his death in 1955 he was a professor at the Institute for Advanced Study at Princeton University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Composed mainly of correspondence between Einstein and the executor of his estate, Otto Nathan. A number of letters discuss the fate of Jews in Europe and other aspects of World War II. Others deal with Brandeis University, Jewish affairs in the United States, and personal matters. Also included are letters from Elsa Einstein to Nathan, as well as some manuscripts, ephemera, and photographs of Einstein.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Librarywithout any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

odd.head: Encoding Information
odd.p: Encoded by Elizabeth Clarke, December 2006. Updated by Emma Gronbeck, March 2023.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Arranged and described by Ronald D. Patkus and Rachel Schles. Last updated 2003.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Gift of Morris and Adele Bergreen, 2003.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Morris and Adele Bergreen Albert Einstein Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into 3 series and arranged chronologically within each of those series.

did.unittitle: Series II. Manuscripts and Ephemera of Albert Einstein,
Albert Einstein to Otto Nathan, written at the conclusion of a letter from Otto Nathan to Albert Einstein,
Albert Einstein autograph draft unsigned On the recto of a sheet of autograph mathematical equations. At the bottom of the letter are notes meant for Otto Nathan and Herbert Maass,
Albert Einstein to Otto Nathan Written at the bottom and side of a letter from Otto Nathan to Albert Einstein,
Albert Einstein to Otto Nathan written at the bottom of the letter from Maass and Davidson ,

did.unitdate: 11 June [according to Nathan should be July] 1953

did.unittitle: Otto Nathan, signed "A.E." Richard Grossman. Likely Otto to Nathan's handwritten copy of a letter by Albert Einstein,
Otto Nathan to the American Jewish Congress,
Otto Nathan to Martin Blackman. With typed brochure titled "The Writings of Albert Einstein",
Charles A. Beard to Albert Einstein,

unittitle.archref: Michael Nisselson to Albert Einstein. In an initialed note below Einstein has written. "Not Answered A.E.,"

did.unittitle: Michael Gruning to The Einstein Archives,
SERIES II: MANUSCRIPTS AND EPHEMERA OF ALBERT EINSTEIN
Unsigned typescript for the "Labor/Chest May Day Demonstration",
Typed, autographed manuscript signed. Concerning the National Council of Jewish Women ending with a call to help the Jewish people,
Typescript unsigned memorandum regarding Einstein's last will,
Twelve line poem written in honor of Helene Dukas,
Twenty line birthday poem possibly for Otto Nathan,
Typescript [Apparently for The National Wartime Conference on May 1944],
Statement regarding George Alpert and Brandeis University's Board of Trustees,
Typescript regarding U.S. relations with Russia,
English translation of typescript regarding U.S. relations with Russia,
Typescript on the subject of war atomic weapons and politics,
Manuscript discussing war, politics, world cooperation, etc.,
Typescript, regarding Greenglass' fallibility as a witness and two points where the Rosenbergs could be found to have acted suspiciously,
Typescript concerning the breakdown of collective security,
Unsigned manuscript probably pre-World War II,
A page removed from a calendar to note the book belongs to Otto Nathan and in the case of an accident Einstein should be contacted,
Five checks signed in full by Albert Einstein,
Albert Einstein and Henry Wallace signed petition,
Albert Einstein in a v-neck sweater,
Five mounted photographs of Albert Einstein,

Albert Einstein looking directly into the camera,

Albert Einstein in 3/4 profile looking directly into camera,
Albert Einstein shown in 3/4 profile with pen clip showing on the collar of his sweatshirt,
Albert Einstein seated wearing a sweater with his head slightly raised in profile,
Albert Einstein sitting wearing a wing-tip collared shirt,
Albert Einstein and his wife, Tokyo,
Albert Einstein and Charles St. John with St. John's spectrographic apparatus,
'Albert Einstein' by Joseph Scharl, Oil painting on burlap 1/2 portrait of Albert Einstein,
'Professor Einstein' by S. Elfinger, charcoal drawing of Albert Einstein's head,
Albert Einstein and Otto Nathan walking in garden,
Albert Einstein smoking in garden with Otto Nathan,
Albert Einstein smoking in garden with Otto Nathan,
Albert Einstein on a porch wearing fuzzy slippers,
